My Work at Team Anantam Space Research & Rocketry (TARSR)

As a Senior Design Engineer at Team Anantam Space Research & Rocketry (TARSR), I specialize in the design, aerodynamic optimization, and performance evaluation of model and research rockets. My work focuses on translating analytical design data into practical, high-precision launch systems that perform reliably in field conditions. Below are some of the most exciting projects I’ve been part of:

🚀 BLUE BUTCHER SERIES

Subsonic Model Rocket R&D

Designed a family of subsonic research rockets reaching apogees of 150–750 meters. Responsible for aerodynamic refinement, recovery subsystem integration, and multi-stage propulsion validation. The series demonstrated TARSR’s early success in precision modeling and launch stability.

🛰 NAMBI MODEL ROCKET

IGNITE INDIA 2025 — National-Level Competition

Developed a high-performance model rocket powered by a J-Class 1000 N motor, achieving a stable apogee of 750 meters. Integrated real-time telemetry, sensor-based payload systems, and gyro stabilization for in-flight data acquisition. This project represented the perfect harmony of mechanical precision and electronic intelligence.

🔥 RED TITAN

Supersonic Research Rocket Design

Conceptualized and simulated a supersonic rocket exceeding Mach 1 flight conditions. Led aerodynamic shaping, stability analysis, and CFD simulations using SOLIDWORKS 2024. Red Titan reflects the team’s transition toward high-speed propulsion and computational fluid design.
